name: Looking for a big sword elf build
author: Michelangelo

posts.author: Michelangelo
posts.content:
Hi all,

Recently I got my hands on a NWN:EE and thought to revisiting the city of Neverwinter after a loooooong time after playing the original. I have started out over a dozen times and never got past chapter 2 as I was never happy with a character I could develop on my own, being a complete noob at it it.

I loved playing assassin before (as he could fight, pick locks and traps, set traps and use magic devises in a pinch) but the mechanics of fighting was kind a bothersome (hitting and then retreating into the dark all the time). However I recently got to watch a anime called Berserker, a bit older but liked the story of Guts. That got me started thinking and I would like to ask for your help in coming up with a build for my next run.

I would like to play a small elf with a gigantic sword, there is something strangely fascinating about a small creature hulling a gigantic weapon.

Environment preference - PvM build, something I can take through the Original Campaigns and beyond

Race preference - Elf

Class preference - none but I would like to avoid a character that is dependence on casting a lot of biffing and protective spells just to keep up. I have no problems with a few but casting 10 spells all the time is just bothersome

Weapon preference - giant two handed sword, other gigantic weapons could also be considered

Also - no alignment restrictions, I have trouble staying evil :-)

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello and welcome, Michelangelo - good to meet you!

At the risk of blowing my own trumpet, how about this one for a greatsword-wielding elf? Firewing of Corellon

She might involve a bit of hard work at earlier levels, but boy does she grow into her skin. Now, given that the Original Campaign will finish with you on about level 17/18, you might want to think about having her continue on in another module that will take you all the way to level 40. Mines of Twin Summit would be a good one to show off her increasing power. You just import your character there after you've completed the OC. If you'd be interested, we can give you the details later.

Anyway, see what you think of the build (just click on the underscored words) and get back to us.

Cheers

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
It's called "Berserk" & if you liked the anime, then better read the manga, it's even better Michelangelo.

Anyway, to play Guts properly you'll need a Greatsword & Dev. Critical for sure, sorry, no hand-cannon for you in NwN but for the rest, Stagmeister's Firewing of Corellon would do mighty fine.

posts.author: Michelangelo
posts.content: Thanks, I will pop by the Firewing thread and ask. It would be mighty interesting to see gunpowder weapons in NWN :-)
